ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow

Class SerialEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow.SerialEncoder

  • public class SerialEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows to encode and decode byte arrays to be handled through a serial (UART) interface. The encoding used here must match the one used on the Yellow robot. Note: This encoding is necessary because the Yellow robot has only serial access to the WiFi connection. That is, there is no TCP/IP stack to handle packet communication.
    Author:
    gabriel.gruener@bfh.ch

      • getState

        public SerialEncoder.ReadState getState()
        Retrieve the state of the read decoder.
        Returns:

      • push

        public SerialEncoder.ReadState push(int i)
        Pushes a received byte into the message, removing escaped bytes and checksum. Updates #readState as the payload is parsed, arriving to the state ReadState.DONE when the message is complete.
        Parameters:
        i - the byte received.

      • getMessage

        public byte[] getMessage()
        Retrieves the decoded message. Note the message will only be complete if the decode state is ReadState.DONE
        Returns:
        Byte array with message payload.

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(byte[] payload)
        Encode the given byte array for serial transmission.
        Parameters:
        payload - The byte array to encode.
        Returns:
        The encoded byte array.
